1.verse: Inasmuch as many have taken it in hand to compile a narrative concerning the things that have been accomplished among us,

2.verse: just as those who were, from the beginning, eyewitnesses and became ministers of the word, have delivered it to us,

3.verse: it seemed good to me also, having carefully investigated everything for a long time, to write down the events in an orderly sequence for you, most excellent Theophilus,

4.verse: so that you may know the truth about the things that you have been taught.

5.verse: There was in the days of Herod, king of Judah, a certain priest by the name of Zechariah, of the priestly division of Abijah; and his wife was from the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.

6.verse: And they were both righteous before God, walking blamelessly in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord.

7.verse: But they did not have a child, because Elizabeth was barren, and both of them were advanced in years.

8.verse: Now it happened, while he was serving as priest before God when his priestly division was on duty,

9.verse: that according to the custom of the priesthood, he was chosen by lot to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense,

10.verse: and the whole crowd of people was there, praying outside at the hour of incense.

11.verse: And an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing at the right side of the altar of incense.

12.verse: Zechariah was troubled when he saw him and fear fell upon him.

13.verse: But the angel said to him: “Do not fear, Zechariah, because your prayer has been heard, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you will call his name John.

14.verse: And for you there will be joy and gladness, and many will rejoice because of his birth,

15.verse: for he will be great before the Lord. And he must not drink wine and strong drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.

16.verse: and he will restore many of the sons of Israel to the Lord their God.

17.verse: He will go on before him, in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of fathers toward their children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous, in order to establish for the Lord a people who are prepared for him.”

18.verse: But Zechariah said to the angel, “How can I be sure of this? For I am an old man and my wife is advanced in years?”

19.verse: And the angel answered, saying to him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and I was sent to speak to you, and to tell you the good news of these things.

20.verse: And now you will be reduced to silence and not be able to speak until the day in which these things happen, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their time.”

21.verse: And the people were waiting for Zechariah, and they began to wonder why he stayed so long in the temple.

22.verse: When he came out, he was not able to speak to them; and they realized that he had seen a vision in the temple (he kept gesturing to them and remained mute).

23.verse: When the days of his priestly service were over, he went to his home.

24.verse: After these days, Elizabeth his wife became pregnant, and she kept herself in seclusion for five months, saying,

25.verse: “Thus the Lord has done for me in the days in which he looked with favor to take away my reproach among people.”

26.verse: In the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a town of Galilee that was called Nazareth,

27.verse: to a virgin pledged to be married to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David, and the name of the virgin was Mary.

28.verse: And he came to her and said, “Greetings, highly favored one, the Lord is with you!”

29.verse: She was thoroughly troubled by what he said, and tried to discern what sort of greeting this could be.

30.verse: And the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.

31.verse: Look, you will conceive in your womb and give birth to a son, and you will call his name Jesus.

32.verse: This very one will be great, and will be called the Son of the Most High; and the Lord God will give him the throne of his father David.

33.verse: He will reign over the house of Jacob for all time, and of his kingdom there will be no end.”

34.verse: Mary said to the angel, “How will this be, since I have no sexual relationship with a man?”

35.verse: And the angel answered, saying to her, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you and the power of the Most High will overshadow you: therefore the child to be born will be holy; he will be called the Son of God.

36.verse: Look, your relative Elizabeth, she also has conceived a son in her old age; indeed, this is the sixth month with her who was called barren.

37.verse: For nothing will be impossible for God.”

38.verse: So Mary said, “Behold, the maidservant of the Lord! Let it happen to me according to your word.” Then the angel departed from her.

39.verse: In those days Mary arose and went into the hill country with eagerness, to a town in Judah,

40.verse: and she entered into the house of Zechariah. She greeted Elizabeth,

41.verse: and when Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the baby leaped in her womb. Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit,

42.verse: and exclaimed with a loud cry, saying, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!

43.verse: And why should this happen to me that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

44.verse: For behold, as the sound of your greeting came into my ear, the baby in my womb leaped for joy.

45.verse: Blessed is she who believed that there would be a fulfillment of what was spoken to her from the Lord.”

46.verse: And Mary said, “My soul magnifies the Lord,

47.verse: and my spirit rejoices because of God my Savior,

48.verse: for he has looked on the humble estate of his maidservant. For behold, from now on all generations will declare me blessed,

49.verse: because the Almighty has done great things for me. His name is holy,

50.verse: and his mercy extends to those who fear him, from generation to generation.

51.verse: “He has displayed might with his arm; he has scattered those who are proud in the thoughts of their hearts.

52.verse: He has brought down rulers from their thrones and exalted those of humble position.

53.verse: He has filled the hungry with good things, but the rich he has sent away empty.

54.verse: He has helped his servant Israel, remembering his mercy,

55.verse: as he spoke to our fathers, to Abraham and his descendants for all time.”

56.verse: Mary remained with her about three months and returned to her home.

57.verse: The time arrived for Elizabeth to give birth, and she bore a son.

58.verse: And her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had greatly displayed his mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her.

59.verse: On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they wanted to call him by the name of his father, Zechariah.

60.verse: But his mother responded, saying, “No; he is rather to be called John.”

61.verse: And they said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name.”

62.verse: So they motioned to his father to find out what he would like him to be called.

63.verse: He asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And they were all astonished.

64.verse: Instantly his mouth was opened and his tongue loosed, and he began to speak, praising God.

65.verse: Fear came upon all who lived around them, and all these things were being talked about throughout the whole hill country of Judea.

66.verse: All who heard took these things to their heart, saying, “What, then, will this child be?” For the hand of the Lord was with him.

67.verse: Zechariah, his father, was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied, saying,

68.verse: “Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, for he has visited and brought redemption to his people.

69.verse: For he has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of David his servant,

70.verse: just as he spoke through the mouth of his holy prophets from of old,

71.verse: that we should be saved from our enemies, and from the hand of all who hate us.

72.verse: He has done this to show the mercy promised to our fathers, and to remember his holy covenant,

73.verse: the oath that he swore to our father Abraham, to grant us

74.verse: that we, being rescued from the hand of enemies, might serve him without fear,

75.verse: in holiness and righteousness before him all our days.

76.verse: And you, child, will be called prophet of the Most High; for you will go before the Lord to prepare his ways,

77.verse: to give his people the knowledge of salvation by the forgiveness of their sins,

78.verse: because of the tender mercies of our God, by which the rising sun of heaven will visit us,

79.verse: to shine on those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace.”

80.verse: And the child grew and became strong in spirit, and he was in wilderness areas until the day of his public appearance to Israel.

1.verse: In those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus for all the world to be registered.

2.verse: This registration first took place while Quirinius was governing Syria.

3.verse: And everyone went to be registered, each to his own town.

4.verse: So Joseph also went up from Galilee, from the town of Nazareth, to Judea, to the city of David, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and lineage of David,

5.verse: to be registered with Mary, who was pledged in marriage to him, and who was expecting a child.

6.verse: And while they were there, the days were completed for her to give birth,

7.verse: and she gave birth to a son, her firstborn. She wrapped him in swaddling cloths and laid him in a manger, because there was no place for them in the inn.

8.verse: There were shepherds in that region who were living out in the fields and keeping night-watch over their flock.

9.verse: An angel of the Lord suddenly appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terribly afraid.

10.verse: But the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid; for behold, I announce to you good news of a great joy which will be for all the people,

11.verse: because this very day there has been born to you, in the city of David, a savior who is Messiah, the Lord.

12.verse: And this is the sign for you: you will find a baby wrapped in swaddling cloths and lying in a manger.”

13.verse: And suddenly there was, with the angel, a multitude of the heavenly host, praising God and saying,

14.verse: “Glory to God in the highest heaven, and peace on earth among those whom he has favored!”

15.verse: When the angels departed from them into heaven, the shepherds began to speak to one another, “Well, let us go across to Bethlehem and see this thing that has taken place, which the Lord has made known to us.”

16.verse: So they came in haste and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby lying in the manger.

17.verse: And when they had seen him, they made it known concerning the message that had been spoken to them about this child.

18.verse: And all who heard marveled about what had been told to them by the shepherds.

19.verse: Mary remembered all that had been said, pondering them in her heart.

20.verse: Then the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all that they had heard and seen, just as it had been told to them.

21.verse: When eight days had gone by and it was time to circumcise him, his name was called Jesus, the name he was called by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.

22.verse: And when the days were completed for their purification according to the law of Moses, they brought him up to Jerusalem to present to the Lord

23.verse: (as it is written in the law of the Lord: “Every male who first opens the womb will be called holy to the Lord”)

24.verse: and to offer a sacrifice according to what is said in the law of the Lord, “A pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.”

25.verse: Now there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon, and this man was righteous and devout, waiting expectantly for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.

26.verse: And it had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.

27.verse: So he came in the Spirit into the temple, and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him according to the custom of the Law,

28.verse: he received him in his arms and blessed God and said,

29.verse: “Now, Master, you are dismissing your servant in peace, according to your word;

30.verse: because my eyes have seen your salvation,

31.verse: which you have prepared in the presence of all peoples,

32.verse: a light for revelation to the Gentiles, and for glory for your people Israel.”

33.verse: His father and mother were amazed at the things that were being said about him.

34.verse: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary his mother, “Take note, this child is appointed for the fall and rising of many in Israel, and for a sign that will be opposed

35.verse: (and a sword will pierce your own soul also), that thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.”

36.verse: Now there was a prophetess, Anna, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was advanced in years, having lived with her husband seven years from her virginity,

37.verse: and then she was a widow until she was eighty-four years old. She did not leave the temple, worshipping night and day with fasting and prayer.

38.verse: At that very hour she came up and began to give thanks to God and continued to speak of him to all who were waiting expectantly for the redemption of Jerusalem.

39.verse: And when they had completed everything according to the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own town, Nazareth.

40.verse: And the child grew and became strong, filled with wisdom; and the favor of God was upon him.

41.verse: Now his parents went year by year to Jerusalem for the feast of Passover

42.verse: And when he was twelve years old, when they went up according to the custom of the feast

43.verse: and had completed the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem, and his parents did not know it.

44.verse: Thinking him to be in the caravan, they went a day’s journey, but then began looking for him among their relatives and acquaintances.

45.verse: When they did not find him, they went back to Jerusalem to look for him.

46.verse: Then after three days they found him in the temple, seated in the midst of the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.

47.verse: And all who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.

48.verse: And when they saw him, they were astounded, and his mother said to him, “Child, why did you treat us like this? Look, your father and I have been terribly worried trying to find you.”

49.verse: And he said to them, “Why is it that you were looking for me? Did you not know that I would have to be in my Father’s house?”

50.verse: But they did not understand the saying that he spoke to them.

51.verse: Then he went down with them and came to Nazareth and was obedient to them. And his mother treasured all that was said in her heart.

52.verse: And Jesus advanced in wisdom and in stature, and in favor with God and man.

1.verse: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was governing Judea, and Herod was tetrarch of Galilee and Philip his brother tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene,

2.verse: when Annas was high priest, and Caiaphas, the word of God came upon John the son of Zechariah in the wilderness.

3.verse: And he went into the region all around the Jordan, proclaiming a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

4.verse: As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, “The voice of one calling out in the wilderness: ‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make the paths straight for him.

5.verse: Every ravine will be filled in and every mountain and hill will be leveled off; the crooked places will become straight and the rough places will become smooth roads.

6.verse: Then will all flesh see the salvation of God!’”

7.verse: So he said to the crowds that were coming out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?

8.verse: Bear, then, fruits worthy of repentance. Do not even begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I say to you that God is able, out of these stones, to raise up children to Abraham.

9.verse: Indeed, already the axe is laid to the root of the trees; therefore every tree that does not bear good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.

10.verse: The crowds asked him saying, “What, then, shall we do?”

11.verse: And he would answer, saying to them, “He who has two tunics, let him share with the one who has none; and he who has food, let him do the same.”

12.verse: Tax collectors also came to be baptized and they said to him, “Teacher, what should we do?”

13.verse: And he said to them, “Collect no more than what has been prescribed for you.”

14.verse: Soldiers were also questioning him, saying, “And we, what should we do?” He said to them, “Do not extort money from anyone, or accuse them falsely; and be content with your wages.”

15.verse: Since the people were filled with anticipation and all were questioning in their hearts about John (“Could he perhaps be the Messiah?”)

16.verse: John gave an answer to all, saying, “I indeed baptize you with water, but there is coming one who is mightier than I, of whom I am not worthy to untie the thong of his sandals. He it is who will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.

17.verse: His winnowing fork is in his hand, to clear his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his granary; but the chaff he will burn with unquenchable fire.”

18.verse: And with many other words he exhorted the people, and evangelized them.

19.verse: But Herod the tetrarch, when he was reproved by him concerning Herodias, the wife of his brother, and concerning all the evil things which Herod had done,

20.verse: added this also to them all: he confined John in prison.

21.verse: Now when all the people had been baptized, and when Jesus was baptized and was praying, the heavens were opened,

22.verse: and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form, like a dove; and a voice came from heaven, “You are my Son, the Beloved; with you I am well pleased.”

23.verse: So Jesus, when he began his ministry, was about thirty years of age, being the son (as it was thought) of Joseph, the son of Helix,

24.verse: the son of Matzot, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,

25.verse: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,

26.verse: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,

27.verse: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,

28.verse: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,

29.verse: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,

30.verse: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,

31.verse: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,

32.verse: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Sala, the son of Nahshon,

33.verse: the son of Amminadab, the son of Admin, the son of Arni, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,

34.verse: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,

35.verse: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,

36.verse: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,

37.verse: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Kenan,

38.verse: the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.

1.verse: Then Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit in the wilderness

2.verse: for forty days, being tempted by the devil. And he ate nothing during those days, so when they were completed he was hungry.

3.verse: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread.”

4.verse: And Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone.’”

5.verse: Then he led him up and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.

6.verse: The devil said to him, “To you I will give all this authority and their glory, for to me it has been handed over, and to whomever I desire, I give it.

7.verse: If you then will bow down and worship me, all this will be yours.”

8.verse: But Jesus answered, saying to him, “It is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God and him only shall you serve.’”

9.verse: Then he took him to Jerusalem and set him on the pinnacle of the temple and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here;

10.verse: for it is written, ‘To his angels he will give orders concerning you, to protect you,’

11.verse: and, ‘On their hands they will raise you up, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’”

12.verse: But answering Jesus said to him, “It has been said, ‘You are not to put the Lord your God to the test.’”

13.verse: And when he had completed every kind of temptation, the devil departed from him until a more favorable time.

14.verse: Then Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee, and a report about him spread throughout the whole countryside.

15.verse: He was teaching in their synagogues, being praised by everyone.

16.verse: He went to Nazareth where he had been brought up and, as was his custom on the Sabbath day, he went into the synagogue and stood up to read.

17.verse: And the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was given to him, and when he had unrolled the scroll, he found the place where it was written,

18.verse: “The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to preach the good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim liberty to the captives and recovery of sight to the blind, to send the oppressed away in liberty,

19.verse: to proclaim the year acceptable to the Lord.”

20.verse: When he had rolled the scroll and given it back to the attendant, he sat down. And the eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fixed on him.

21.verse: And he set about telling them, “Today this scripture has been fulfilled in your ears.”

22.verse: They were all bearing witness to him in that they were marveling at the gracious words that were coming from his mouth. Then they said, “Is not this Joseph’s son?”

23.verse: And he said to them, “No doubt you will quote this proverb to me: ‘Physician, heal yourself.’ What we have heard happened in Capernaum, do also here in your hometown.”

24.verse: And he said, “I tell you the truth, no prophet is acceptable in his hometown.

25.verse: But in truth I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut up for three years and six months, as a great famine spread throughout the whole land;

26.verse: and to none of them was Elijah sent, only to Zarephath, in the territory of Sidon, to a widow woman.

27.verse: And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and none of them was cleansed, only Naaman, the Syrian.”

28.verse: And everyone in the synagogue was filled with wrath when they heard these things.

29.verse: They rose up, drove him out of the town, and took him to a cliff of the hill on which their town was built, so that they could cast him down.

30.verse: But he passed through their midst and went on his way.

31.verse: And he went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee. He was teaching them on the Sabbath;

32.verse: and they were astonished at his teaching, because his message was with authority.

33.verse: Now in the synagogue there was a man who had the spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out in a loud voice,

34.verse: “Ha! What do you have to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”

35.verse: But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!” And when the demon had thrown him down in their midst, he came out of him, having done him no harm.

36.verse: Astonishment came over them all, and they said to one another, “What is this teaching? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits and they come out!”

37.verse: So the news about him went out into every place in the surrounding region.

38.verse: After leaving from the synagogue, Jesus went to Simon’s house. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering a severe fever, and they made a request to him on her behalf.

39.verse: Standing over her he rebuked the fever, and it left her. Immediately she got up and began to wait on them.

40.verse: As the sun was going down, all those who had any sick with various diseases brought them to him. Placing his hands on each one of them, he healed them.

41.verse: Also, demons came out from many, crying out and saying, “You are the Son of God!” But he rebuked them and did not allow them to speak, because they knew him to be the Christ.

42.verse: When daylight came he left and went to a deserted place. And the crowds were looking for him. They came to him and tried to keep him from leaving them,

43.verse: but he said to them, “I must preach the good news of the kingdom of God in the other towns as well; because for this purpose I was sent.”

44.verse: So he kept on preaching in the synagogues of Judea.

1.verse: It happened that, when the crowd was pressing around him and listening to the word of God, he was standing beside the lake of Gennesaret

2.verse: and he saw two boats by the lake, but the fishermen had gotten out of them and were washing their nets.

3.verse: He got into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the shore. Then he sat down and taught the crowds from the boat.

4.verse: When he stopped speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep water and lower your nets for a catch.”

5.verse: But Simon responded, saying, “Master, all night long we have toiled and have caught nothing! But at your word I will lower the nets.”

6.verse: And when they had done this, they enclosed a large number of fish, and their nets were about to break.

7.verse: They signaled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both the boats, so that they were about to sink.

8.verse: When Simon Peter saw this, he fell at the knees of Jesus, saying, “Go away from me, Lord, for I am a sinful man!”

9.verse: For amazement had taken hold of him and all who were with him because of the catch of fish that they had taken,

10.verse: and so also were James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. But Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid; from now on you will be catching men.”

11.verse: Then they brought the boats to shore, left everything, and followed him.

12.verse: It happened that, when he was in one of the cities, there was a man full of leprosy. And seeing Jesus, he fell on his face and implored him, saying, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”

13.verse: And Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing; become clean.” And immediately the leprosy left him.

14.verse: Then Jesus ordered the man to tell no one: “Go, rather, and show yourself to the priest and make an offering for your cleansing, just as Moses commanded as a testimony to them.”

15.verse: Then the word about him spread even more, and large crowds would come together to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.

16.verse: But he would go off to wilderness places and pray.

17.verse: It happened on one of those days when he was teaching, and sitting there were Pharisees and teachers of the law who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem, and power from the Lord was there for him to heal,

18.verse: and there were men carrying on a stretcher a man who was paralyzed. They were trying to bring him in and place him before Jesus.

19.verse: But not finding any way to bring him in on account of the crowd, they went up on the roof and lowered him, along with the stretcher, through the tiles into the midst, in front of Jesus.

20.verse: And when he saw their faith, he said, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”

21.verse: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to ponder, saying, “Who is this who speaks blasphemies? Who is able to forgive sins except God alone?”

22.verse: Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, answered, saying to them, “Why are you questioning in your hearts?

23.verse: Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins have been forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?

24.verse: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralyzed man, “I say to you, get up, and when you have picked up your stretcher, go to your house.”

25.verse: Immediately, having stood up before them and picked up what he had been lying on, he went off to his house praising God.

26.verse: Astonishment gripped them all, and they began to glorify God. They were filled with awe, saying, “We have seen incredible things today.”

27.verse: After this he went out and saw a tax collector named Levi, sitting at the tax booth. And he said to him, “Follow me.”

28.verse: So leaving everything, he got up and followed him.

29.verse: And Levi made a great banquet for him in his house, and there was a great crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining at table with them.

30.verse: And the Pharisees and their scribes were grumbling at his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with the tax collectors and sinners?”

31.verse: In response Jesus said to them, “Those who are healthy have no need of a doctor, but those who are sick do;

32.verse: I have not come to call righteous people, but sinners, to repentance.”

33.verse: And they said to him, “The disciples of John often fast and offer prayers, so also do the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours continue to eat and drink.”

34.verse: So Jesus said to them, “Certainly you cannot make the wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them?

35.verse: The days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast in those days.”

36.verse: He also told a parable to them: “No one tears a patch from a new garment and sews it on an old garment. If he does, he both tears the new, and the patch from the new will not match the old.

37.verse: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the new wine will burst the skins and it will be spilled, and the skins will be destroyed.

38.verse: Rather, new wine is to be put into new wineskins

39.verse: And no one drinking the old desires the new; for he says, ‘The old is good.’”

1.verse: One Sabbath, as Jesus was going through grainfields, his disciples began to pick some heads of grain, rub them in their hands, and eat them.

2.verse: Some of the Pharisees asked, “Why do you do what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”

3.verse: In answer to them Jesus said, “Have you not read what David did when he was hungry, he and those who were with him?

4.verse: how he entered the house of God, and taking the Bread of the Presence, he ate it and gave some to those with him—which is not lawful for any but the priests to eat?”

5.verse: Then he said to them, “The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”

6.verse: It happened on another Sabbath that he went into the synagogue and began to teach. A man was there whose right hand was withered.

7.verse: So the scribes and the Pharisees were watching him carefully to see whether he healed on the Sabbath, so that they could find a reason to accuse him.

8.verse: But he knew their thoughts, so he said to the man with the withered hand, “Get up and stand here in front.” So he got up and came forward.

9.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you whether it is lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do harm, to save life or to destroy it?”

10.verse: After looking around at them all, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did it, and his hand was restored.

11.verse: But they were filled with senseless anger and began discussing with one another what they might do to Jesus.

12.verse: It happened in those days that Jesus went out to the mountain to pray, and spent the whole night in prayer to God.

13.verse: When day came, he gathered his disciples and chose from them twelve, whom he called apostles:

14.verse: Simon (whom he called Peter), and Andrew his brother, and James, and John, and Philip, and Bartholomew,

15.verse: and Matthew, and Thomas, and James son of Alphaeus, and Simon who was called a Zealot,

16.verse: and Judas son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.

17.verse: Then, coming down with them from the mountain, he took his stand on a level place. A large crowd of his disciples was there along with a great number of people from all over Judea and Jerusalem and from the coastal region of Tyre and Sidon.

18.verse: They had come to hear him speak and to be healed of their diseases; and those who were troubled with unclean spirits were healed.

19.verse: And all the crowd was trying to touch him, because power was coming out from him and healing them all.

20.verse: Then, looking up at his disciples, he said: “Blessed are you poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.

21.verse: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be satisfied. “Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.

22.verse: Blessed are you when people hate you, and when they exclude you and insult you and reject your name as evil on account of the Son of Man!

23.verse: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven. For their fathers treated the prophets in the same way.

24.verse: “But, woe to you who are rich, for you have received your consolation.

25.verse: Woe to you who have had your fill now, for you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.

26.verse: Woe to you when all people speak well of you, for their fathers treated the false prophets in the same way.

27.verse: “But I say to you who are listening to me: Love your enemies; do good to those who hate you,

28.verse: bless those who curse you; pray for those who threaten you.

29.verse: To the one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also; and from the one who takes your coat, do not withhold even your shirt.

30.verse: To all who ask of you, give, and from the one who takes away what belongs to you, do not demand it back.

31.verse: “And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them.

32.verse: And if you love those who love you, what credit is it to you? For even sinners love those who love them.

33.verse: And if you do good to those who love you, what credit is that to you? Even sinners do the same.

34.verse: And if you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners that they may receive in return.

35.verse: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return. Then your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to the ungrateful and evil.

36.verse: “Be compassionate, just as your Father is compassionate.

37.verse: Do not judge, and you will not be judged; do not condemn, and you will not be condemned; forgive, and you will be forgiven;

38.verse: give, and it will be given to you—good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, will be poured into your lap. For by what measure you measure, it will be measured in return to you.”

39.verse: He spoke to them also a parable: “Can a blind man lead a blind man? Won’t they both fall into a ditch?

40.verse: A student is not above his teacher, but everyone when fully prepared will be like his teacher.

41.verse: “Why do you look at the speck in the eye of your brother, but do not notice the beam in your own eye?

42.verse: How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me take out the speck that is in your eye,’ when you yourself don’t see the log that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First take the log out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take out the speck that is in your brother’s eye.

43.verse: “For it is not a good tree that bears bad fruit, nor again, a bad tree that bears good fruit,

44.verse: for each tree is known by its own fruit. For they do not gather figs from thornbushes, nor do they pick grapes from brambles.

45.verse: The good person out of the good treasure of his heart produces good, and the evil person out of his evil treasure produces evil, for out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.

46.verse: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not do what I say?

47.verse: Everyone who comes to me and hears my words and does them—I will show you whom he is like:

48.verse: he is like a man building a house, who dug deep and laid the foundation on bedrock; when a flood arose, the river broke against that house but could not shake it, because it had been well built.

49.verse: But the one who hears and does not do them is like a man building a house on the ground without a foundation; when the river burst against it, immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”

1.verse: After he had finished speaking all his sayings in the ears of the people, he entered Capernaum.

2.verse: The servant of a certain centurion who was highly valued by him was sick and about to die.

3.verse: When the centurion heard about Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him to come and heal his servant.

4.verse: And when they came to Jesus, they pleaded with him earnestly, saying, “He is worthy that you should grant this,

5.verse: for he loves our nation and he built the synagogue for us.”

6.verse: So Jesus went with them. And when he was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends, saying to him, “Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy that you should come under my roof.

7.verse: For that reason I did not consider myself worthy to come to you. But speak the word and let my servant be healed.

8.verse: For I too am a man set under authority, having soldiers under me: and I say to this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

9.verse: When Jesus heard these things, he admired him. Turning to the crowd that was following him, he said, “I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such faith.”

10.verse: Returning to the house, those who had been sent found the servant in good health.

11.verse: It happened soon afterward that Jesus went to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd went with him.

12.verse: As Jesus approached the gate of the town, a man who had died was being carried out—the only son of his mother (she was a widow). A large crowd from the town was with her.

13.verse: Seeing her, the Lord had compassion on her and said to her, “Do not weep.”

14.verse: He went up and touched the coffin, and those who carried it stopped. And he said, “Young man, I say to you, get up!”

15.verse: The dead man sat up and began to speak, and Jesus gave him back to his mother.

16.verse: Fear gripped them all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has arisen among us!” and, “God has come to help his people!”

17.verse: This report about Jesus spread throughout Judea and all the surrounding area.

18.verse: The disciples of John told him about all these things. Calling two of his disciples, John

19.verse: sent them to the Lord, saying, “Are you the one who was to come, or should we expect someone else?”

20.verse: The men went to Jesus and said, “John the Baptist has sent us to you to ask, ‘Are you the one who is to come, or should we expect someone else?’”

21.verse: In that hour he healed many people of diseases, sicknesses and evil spirits; and to many who were blind he gave the ability to see.

22.verse: Then he answered, saying to them, “Go and tell John what you have seen and heard: the blind see, the lame walk, lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised, the poor have good news brought to them.

23.verse: And blessed is whoever is not offended by me.”

24.verse: When John’s messengers left, Jesus began to speak to the crowds about John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to look at? A reed being shaken by the wind?

25.verse: But what did you go out to see? A man dressed in luxurious clothing? Those who wear expensive clothing and live in luxury are found in royal palaces.

26.verse: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and one who is more than a prophet.

27.verse: This is he of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.’

28.verse: I tell you, among those born of women there is no one greater than John. Yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”

29.verse: When all the people including the tax collectors (those who had been baptized with the baptism of John) heard this, they declared God just;

30.verse: but the Pharisees and the lawyers (those who had not been baptized by John) rejected the purpose of God for themselves.

31.verse: “To what then shall I compare the people of this generation? What are they like?

32.verse: They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling to one another, they are saying, ‘We played the flute for you, but you did not dance; we wailed in mourning, but you did not weep.’

33.verse: For John the Baptist has come neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’

34.verse: The Son of Man has come both eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look! A man, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’

35.verse: Nevertheless, wisdom is proved right by all her children.”

36.verse: Now one of the Pharisees asked him to eat with him, so he went into the house of the Pharisee and took his place at table.

37.verse: Now there was a woman known in the city as a sinner, and when she learned that Jesus was reclining at table in the house of the Pharisee, she brought an alabaster jar of perfume,

38.verse: and standing behind him at his feet, weeping, she began to bathe his feet with her tears. She kept wiping his feet with the hair of her head, and kissing them and pouring the perfume on them.

39.verse: When the Pharisee who had invited him saw this, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would know who and what kind of woman this is who is touching him—that she is a sinner.”

40.verse: And Jesus, answering, said to him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” And he said, “Teacher, say it.”

41.verse: “There were two debtors to a certain moneylender. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

42.verse: When they were unable to pay, he cancelled the debt of both. Now which of them will love him more?”

43.verse: Simon answered, saying, “I suppose it would be the one for whom he cancelled the greater debt.” And he said to him, “You have judged correctly.”

44.verse: Then turning toward the woman, he said to Simon, “You see this woman? I came into your house; you did not provide water for my feet, but she has bathed my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.

45.verse: You did not give me a kiss, but from the time I came in she has not stopped kissing my feet.

46.verse: You did not anoint my head with oil, but she has poured perfume on my feet.

47.verse: Therefore I can tell you, “Her sins, which were many, have been forgiven, for she loved much. But the one to whom little is forgiven loves little.’”

48.verse: He said to her, “Your sins have been forgiven.”

49.verse: Then those reclining at table with him began to say to themselves, “Who is this, who even forgives sins?”

50.verse: He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”

1.verse: It happened that soon afterward Jesus began to travel around from one town and village to another, proclaiming and bringing the good news of the kingdom of God. The twelve disciples were with him,

2.verse: as well as certain women who had been healed from evil spirits and diseases (Mary who is called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,

3.verse: and Joanna, wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward, and Susanna) and many other women who cared for their needs out of their own resources.

4.verse: As a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from one town after another, he spoke using a parable.

5.verse: “A sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell along the path and was trampled underfoot, and the birds of heaven devoured it.

6.verse: Other seed fell on rock, and when it came up, it withered away, because it had no moisture.

7.verse: Other seed fell in the middle of thorns, and when the thorns came up with it, they choked it.

8.verse: Other seed fell into good soil, and when it came up, it produced fruit a hundredfold.” As he was saying these things he began to call out, “Let the one who has ears to hear, hear.”

9.verse: Now his disciples were questioning him as to what this parable meant.

10.verse: He said, “To you it has been given to know the secrets of the kingdom of God, but to the rest I speak in parables, so that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.

11.verse: “Now this is what the parable means: The seed is the word of God.

12.verse: Those along the path are the ones who hear—then the devil comes and takes away the word from their heart, so that they may not believe and be saved.

13.verse: Those that fall on rock are the ones who, when they hear the word, receive it with joy; but they have no root—they believe for a while but in a time of testing they fall away.

14.verse: As for what fell among the thorns—these are the ones who hear, but as they go on their way they are choked by the cares and riches and pleasures of life, and they do not bring fruit to maturity.

15.verse: But as for that in the good soil—these are the ones who, having heard with an honest and good heart, hold firmly onto the word and bear fruit through patient endurance.

16.verse: “No one after lighting a lamp covers it with a container or puts it under a bed, but places it on a lampstand, so that those who come in may see the light.

17.verse: For nothing is hidden that will not be disclosed, nor secret that will not be known and come to light.

18.verse: “Take care, then, how you hear! For whoever has—more will be given to him; and whoever does not have—even what he seems to have will be taken away from him.”

19.verse: The mother of Jesus and his brothers came to him, but they were not able to get near him because of the crowd.

20.verse: It was reported to him, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.”

21.verse: In response he said to them, “Those who hear and do the word of God are my mother and my brothers.”

22.verse: It happened in one of those days that he and his disciples got into a boat, and he said to them, “Let us go across to the other side of the lake.” So they put out from shore.

23.verse: As they were sailing along, he fell asleep, and a windstorm swept down on the lake and they were being swamped and were in danger.

24.verse: They went to Jesus and woke him up, saying, “Master, Master, we are about to perish!” Having been awakened he rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they stopped, and there was a calm.

25.verse: He said to them, “Where is your faith?” They were afraid and amazed, saying to one another, “Who, then, is this that he commands even the winds and the water and they obey him?”

26.verse: Then they came to land in the region of the Gerasenes, which is across the lake from Galilee.

27.verse: When he stepped out on the land, a man from the town met him, who was possessed by demons, and for a long time had not worn clothes or had not lived in a house but among the tombs.

28.verse: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell prostate before him and in a loud voice said, “What have I to do with you, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, do not torment me!?”

29.verse: For Jesus had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man; for many times it had seized him and he was kept under guard and bound with chains and shackles, yet he would break his bonds and be driven by the demon into the desert.

30.verse: Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” And he said, “Legion.” (For many demons had entered into him.)

31.verse: And they begged him not to order them to go away into the abyss.

32.verse: A large herd of pigs was grazing there on the hillside; and the demons begged Jesus to permit them to go into them, and he gave them permission.

33.verse: The demons came out of the man and went into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and drowned.

34.verse: When the herdsmen saw what had happened, they fled and reported it in the town and in the countryside.

35.verse: Then people went out to see what happened, and they came to Jesus and found the man from whom the demons had come out, sitting at the feet of Jesus, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

36.verse: Those who had seen it told them how the demon-possessed man had been healed.

37.verse: Then all the people of the surrounding region of the Gerasenes asked Jesus to go away from them, because they were seized with a great fear. So he got into a boat and returned.

38.verse: But the man from whom the demons had gone out begged to go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,

39.verse: “Return to your house and declare how much God has done for you.” And he went about the whole city proclaiming what Jesus had done for him.

40.verse: As Jesus was returning the crowd welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.

41.verse: Just then there came a man named Jairus. This man was a ruler of the synagogue, and he fell at the feet of Jesus and implored him to come into his house,

42.verse: because he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, and she was dying. As he went, the crowds were pressing in on him.

43.verse: Now there was a woman who had suffered a flow of blood for twelve years, but she was not able to be healed by anyone.

44.verse: She came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak and at once her flow of blood stopped.

45.verse: And Jesus said, “Who was it who touched me?” As everyone denied it, Peter said, “Master, the crowds are pressing in on all sides and crowding you.”

46.verse: But Jesus said, “Someone touched me, for I was aware of power going out from me.”

47.verse: Seeing that she had not escaped notice, the woman stepped forward, trembling, and fell down before him. She declared in the presence of all the people why she had touched him and how she had been healed at once.

48.verse: Then Jesus said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well; go in peace.”

49.verse: While he was still speaking, someone came from the house of the synagogue-ruler, saying, “Your daughter is dead; do not bother the Teacher any longer.”

50.verse: When Jesus heard this, he said to him, “Do not be afraid, only believe, and she will get better.”

51.verse: When he went into the house he did not allow anyone to go in with him except Peter and John and James, and the father of the child and her mother.

52.verse: And all the people were weeping and mourning for her. He said, “Stop weeping, for she did not die; but is sleeping.”

53.verse: And they laughed at him, knowing that she had died.

54.verse: But taking her by the hand, he called out, saying, “Child, arise!”

55.verse: And her spirit returned, and she got up at once. He commanded that something be given her to eat.

56.verse: Her parents were astonished; but he ordered them to tell no one what had happened.

1.verse: And he called together the twelve and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.

2.verse: Then he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.

3.verse: He said to them, “Take nothing on the journey—no staff, nor bag, nor bread, nor money. No one is to have two tunics.

4.verse: And whatever house you enter, stay there, and from there go out.

5.verse: And wherever they do not receive you, leave from that town and shake off the dust from your feet as an act that testifies against them.”

6.verse: So they set out and traveled throughout the villages, preaching the good news and healing everywhere.

7.verse: Now Herod the tetrarch heard about everything that was happening, and he was thoroughly perplexed because it was being said by some that John had been raised from the dead,

8.verse: by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that a certain one of the ancient prophets had risen.

9.verse: Herod said, “John I beheaded, but who is this about whom I hear such things?” So he was trying to see him.

10.verse: When the apostles returned they recounted to Jesus all they had done; and he took them and withdrew privately to a town called Bethsaida.

11.verse: When the crowds found out about it, they followed him. So he welcomed them, and spoke to them about the kingdom of God and cured those who had need of healing.

12.verse: Now the day began to wear away, so the twelve came and said to him, “Send the crowd away so that they may go into the surrounding villages and countryside and secure lodging and get provisions, for we are in a desolate place here.”

13.verse: But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.” They said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we go and buy food for all these people.”

14.verse: For there were about five thousand men. He said to his disciples, “Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”

15.verse: And they did so, and had them all sit down.

16.verse: Taking the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and said a blessing and broke them; then he gave them to the disciples to distribute to the crowd.

17.verse: They ate and all were satisfied. What was left over was gathered up by them, twelve baskets of broken pieces.

18.verse: Now it happened that as he was praying by himself, the disciples were near him. He asked them, saying, “Who do the crowds say that I am?”

19.verse: They replied, saying, “John the Baptist; others say, Elijah; still others that one of the ancient prophets has risen.”

20.verse: Then he said to them, “Now you, who do you say that I am?” And Peter replied, “The Christ of God.”

21.verse: Then, with a warning, he commanded them to tell no one this,

22.verse: saying, “It is necessary for the Son of Man to suffer many things and to be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and to be killed, and on the third day to be raised.”

23.verse: Then he said to all, “If someone wants to come after me, let him deny himself, and let him take up his cross daily, and let him follow me.

24.verse: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake, this person will save it.

25.verse: For what good will it do a person who has gained the whole world but has lost or forfeited his very self?

26.verse: For whoever is ashamed of me and of my words, of this one will the Son of Man be ashamed when he comes in his glory and the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.

27.verse: But I tell you most certainly: There are some of those standing here who will certainly not taste death before they see the kingdom of God.”

28.verse: About eight days after these sayings, it happened that he went up on the mountain to pray, taking along Peter and John and James.

29.verse: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was changed, and his clothing turned a dazzling white,

30.verse: and two men were talking with him; they were Moses and Elijah,

31.verse: who had appeared with glorious splendor and were speaking of his departure, which he was soon to accomplish at Jerusalem.

32.verse: Peter and those who were with him were weighed down with sleep, but they kept awake and saw his glory and the two men who were standing with him.

33.verse: As the men were about to leave him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three shelters, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah”—not knowing what he was saying.

34.verse: While he was saying these things, a cloud came and enveloped them; and they were afraid as they entered the cloud.

35.verse: Then a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, the Chosen One; listen to him!”

36.verse: And when the voice had spoken, Jesus was found to be alone. And they kept silent and told no one in those days anything of what they had seen.

37.verse: Now on the next day, it so happened that when they had come down from the mountain, a large crowd met him.

38.verse: Suddenly a man from the crowd cried out, saying, “Teacher, I beg you to look with pity on my son, because he is my only child;

39.verse: and a spirit seizes him, and he suddenly cries out; and it throws him into convulsions and causes him to foam at the mouth; and with difficulty it departs from him, bruising him as it leaves.

40.verse: And I begged your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”

41.verse: In answer Jesus said, “O faithless and perverse generation, how long am I to be with you and put up with you? Bring your son here.”

42.verse: While he was on his way, the demon threw him down and convulsed him. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the child, and gave him back to his father.

43.verse: And all were astonished at the majesty of God. While they were all still marveling at everything he was doing, Jesus said to his disciples,

44.verse: “Let these words sink into your ears: For the Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men.”

45.verse: But they did not understand this saying. It was concealed from them, so that they might not understand it; and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.

46.verse: An argument arose among them as to which of them might be the greatest.

47.verse: But Jesus, aware of the reasoning of their heart, took a child, had him stand at his side,

48.verse: and said to them, “Whoever receives this child in my name receives me, and whoever receives me receives him who sent me. So the one who is least among you all, this is the one who is great.”

49.verse: Answering, John said, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him, because he does not follow you with us.”

50.verse: Jesus said to him, “Do not try to stop him, for the one who is not against you is for you.”

51.verse: Now when the days of his ascension drew near, Jesus set his face to go to Jerusalem.

52.verse: He sent messengers before his face. Having set off, they entered a village of the Samaritans, in order to prepare for him.

53.verse: But they did not receive him, because his face was set toward Jerusalem.

54.verse: Seeing this, his disciples James and John said, “Lord, do you want us to tell fire to come down from heaven and consume them?”

55.verse: But he turned and rebuked them,

56.verse: and they moved on to another village.

57.verse: As they were going along the road, someone said to him, “I will follow you wherever you are heading.”

58.verse: Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”

59.verse: He said to another person, “Follow me.” But that one said, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”

60.verse: Jesus said to him, “Leave the dead to bury their own dead. But you go and proclaim the kingdom of God.”

61.verse: Yet another said, “I will follow you, Lord, but first allow me to say good-bye to those at my home.”

62.verse: Jesus said to him, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.”

1.verse: After this the Lord appointed seventy-two others and sent them on ahead of him, two by two, into every town and place where he himself was about to go.

2.verse: And he said to them, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. Therefore ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest.

3.verse: Go then. I am sending you as lambs into the midst of wolves.

4.verse: Carry no moneybag, no knapsack, no sandals; and greet no one along the way.

5.verse: In whichever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace be to this house!’

6.verse: And if there is a son of peace there, your peace will rest upon him; but if not, it will return to you.

7.verse: Remain in that house, eating and drinking what they provide, for the worker is worthy of his wages. Do not move around from house to house.

8.verse: “In whichever town you enter, and they receive you, eat what is placed before you,

9.verse: and heal the sick in it and say to them, ‘The kingdom of God has come near to you.’

10.verse: In whichever town you enter, and they do not receive you, go out into its streets and say,

11.verse: ‘Even the dust of your town that clings to our feet we wipe off against you. But know this: the kingdom of God has come near.’

12.verse: I tell you, it will be more bearable for Sodom on that day than for that town.

13.verse: Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works that were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, long ago they would have repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

14.verse: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you!

15.verse: And you, Capernaum! Will you be exalted to heaven? No. You will go down to Hades.

16.verse: “The one who listens to you listens to me, and the one who rejects you rejects me, and the one who rejects me rejects the one who sent me.”

17.verse: The seventy-two returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in your name!”

18.verse: He said to them, “I saw Satan as he fell, like a bolt of lightening from the sky.

19.verse: I have given you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and authority over all the power of the enemy; nothing may hurt you at all.

20.verse: However, do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names have been recorded in heaven.”

21.verse: At this time Jesus was filled with joy by the Holy Spirit, and said, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding and revealed them to little children; yes, Father, for such was well-pleasing in your sight.

22.verse: All things have been handed over to me by my Father, and no one knows who the Son is except the Father, or who the Father is except the Son and anyone to whom the Son decides to reveal him.”

23.verse: Having turned to the disciples, he said to them privately, “Fortunate are the eyes that see what you see!

24.verse: For I tell you that many prophets and kings desired to see what you see, but did not see it, and to hear what you hear, but did not hear it.”

25.verse: Once a lawyer stood up to put him to the test, saying, “Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”

26.verse: He said to him, “What is written in the Law? How do you read it?”

27.verse: In answer he said, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your life, and with all your strength, and with all your mind, and your neighbor as yourself.”

28.verse: Jesus said to him, “You have answered correctly; do this, and you will live.”

29.verse: But he, wishing to justify himself, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”

30.verse: Jesus continued, saying, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he fell among robbers. After stripping him of his clothes and beating him, they went off, leaving him half dead.

31.verse: Now by chance a priest was going down by that way and, when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

32.verse: So too a Levite, when he came to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.

33.verse: But a Samaritan who was traveling came to where he was, and when he saw him, was moved with compassion for him.

34.verse: He went to him and bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. Then he set him on his own animal and brought him to an inn and took care of him.

35.verse: The next day he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper, saying, ‘Take care of him, and whatever more you spend, I will repay to you when I come back.’

36.verse: Which of these three, do you think, became a neighbor to the man who fell among the robbers?”

37.verse: He said, “The one who showed mercy to him.” And Jesus said to him, “Go, and you do the same.”

38.verse: Now as they continued on their way, Jesus entered a certain village, and a woman named Martha welcomed him as a guest.

39.verse: She had a sister called Mary, who, after she had seated herself at the feet of the Lord, was listening to his teaching.

40.verse: But Martha was distracted by a lot of preparation. She burst in and said, “Lord, do you not care that my sister has left me to do all the work by myself? Tell her then to help me.”

41.verse: But in answer the Lord said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and troubled about many things,

42.verse: but only one thing is necessary. Mary has chosen the most important thing, which will not be taken away from her.”

1.verse: Jesus was praying in a certain place, and when he finished one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”

2.verse: He said to them, “When you pray, say: ‘Father, may your name be held in honor; may your reign begin.

3.verse: Give us each day our daily bread;

4.verse: and forgive us our sins, for we ourselves forgive everyone indebted to us. And do not bring us into a time of trial.’”

5.verse: He said to them, “Suppose one of you has a friend, and you go to him at midnight and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,

6.verse: since a friend of mine has come to me from a journey and I do not have anything to set before him’;

7.verse: and he from inside answers, saying, ‘Do not cause me trouble; already the door has been locked and my children are with me in bed. I cannot get up and give you anything.’

8.verse: I say to you, even though he will not get up and give him anything because he is his friend, yet because of the prospect of being put to shame he will get up and give him as much as he needs.

9.verse: “So to you I say, ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and it will be opened for you.

10.verse: For everyone who asks receives, and everyone who seeks finds, and for everyone who knocks it will be opened.

11.verse: What father among you, should his son ask for a fish, will instead of a fish, give him a snake?

12.verse: Or should he ask for an egg, will give him a scorpion?

13.verse: If you then, who are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”

14.verse: One day Jesus was casting out a demon that was mute. When the demon came out, the speechless man spoke and the people were amazed.

15.verse: But some of them said, “By Beelzebul, the prince of demons, he casts out demons!”

16.verse: Others, to test him, kept demanding from him a sign from heaven.

17.verse: But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is laid waste, and a house divided against a house falls.

18.verse: And if Satan also has been divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that by Beelzebul I cast out demons.

19.verse: And if by Beelzebul I cast out demons, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.

20.verse: But if I by the finger of God cast out demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

21.verse: “When the strong man, fully armed, guards his own palace, his goods are secured;

22.verse: but when one stronger than he attacks him and overpowers him, he takes away his armor in which he has placed his trust and divides up his spoil.

23.verse: “The one who is not with me is against me; and the one who does not gather with me scatters.

24.verse: “When the unclean spirit departs from a person, it travels through waterless places seeking rest, and not finding one; then it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I departed.’

25.verse: When the spirit returns, it finds the house swept and put in order.

26.verse: Then it goes and takes along seven other spirits more evil than itself, and after going in they settle down to live there. So the last state of that person has become worse than the first.”

27.verse: While he was saying these things, a woman in the crowd raised her voice and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that carried you, and the breasts that nursed you!”

28.verse: But he said, “On the contrary, blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and keep it!”

29.verse: As the crowds were getting larger, Jesus began to say, “This generation is an evil generation; it looks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.

30.verse: For as Jonah became a sign to the people of Nineveh, so the Son of Man will be a sign to this generation.

31.verse: The queen of the South will rise in the judgment with the men of this generation and will condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and behold, something greater than Solomon is here.

32.verse: The men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, something greater than Jonah is here.

33.verse: “No one lights a lamp and puts it in a vault or under a basket, but on a lampstand, so that those who come in can see the light.

34.verse: Your eye is the lamp of the body. When your eye is sound, then your whole body is full of light, but when it is diseased, then your body is full of darkness.

35.verse: Therefore consider whether the ‘light’ that is in you is not darkness.

36.verse: If then your whole body is full of light, having no part of it dark, it will be wholly bright, as when a lamp gives you light with its rays.”

37.verse: When Jesus finished speaking, a Pharisee asked him to have a meal with him, so he went in and reclined at table.

38.verse: The Pharisee was surprised when he observed that Jesus did not wash first, before the meal.

39.verse: The Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the dish; but the inside of you is full of greed and wickedness.

40.verse: Fools! Did not he who made the outside make the inside also?

41.verse: Rather, in connection with what is inside, you should give alms, and then everything will be clean for you.

42.verse: But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every kind of garden herb, yet disregard justice and the love of God. These you should have done, without neglecting the others.

43.verse: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the seat of honor in the synagogues and greetings in the marketplaces.

44.verse: Woe to you! For you are like unmarked tombs; people walk over them without realizing it.”

45.verse: One of the lawyers responded and said to him, “Teacher, in saying these things you insult us as well.”

46.verse: Jesus replied, “Woe to you lawyers also! For you load people down with burdens hard to bear, yet you yourselves will not touch the burdens with one of your fingers.

47.verse: Woe to you! For you build memorials to the prophets, but your fathers killed them.

48.verse: So you are witnesses: you approve of the deeds of your fathers, because while they killed them, you build the memorials.

49.verse: Indeed, for this reason the Wisdom of God said, ‘I will send to them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and persecute,’

50.verse: so that the blood of all the prophets, shed since the foundation of the world, may be charged against this generation,

51.verse: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it will be charged against this generation.

52.verse: Woe to you lawyers! For you have taken away the key of knowledge. You did not enter yourselves, and have hindered those who wanted to enter.”

53.verse: When he went out from there, the scribes and the Pharisees began to be terribly hostile, and to question him sharply about many things,

54.verse: plotting against him, to catch him in something from his mouth.

1.verse: In the meantime, when many thousands of the crowd had gathered so that they were trampling one another, Jesus began to say (to his disciples first), “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

2.verse: Nothing is covered up that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be known.

3.verse: All that you said in the darkness will be heard in the light, and what you said in private rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.

4.verse: “I tell you, my friends, do not fear those who can kill the body, and after that have nothing more that they can do.

5.verse: I will show you whom you should fear: Fear the one who, after he kills, has authority to throw you into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear this one!

6.verse: “Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies? And not one of them is forgotten before God.

7.verse: In fact, even the hairs of your head are all numbered. Do not fear; you are worth more than many sparrows.

8.verse: “I say to you, everyone who acknowledges me before men, the Son of Man will also acknowledge him before the angels of God;

9.verse: but the one who denies me before men will be denied before the angels of God.

10.verse: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but the one who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

11.verse: When they bring you before the synagogues, the rulers, and the authorities, do not worry: How or what words should you use in your defense? or, What should you say?

12.verse: For the Holy Spirit will teach you in that very hour what it is necessary to say.”

13.verse: Someone from the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the family inheritance with me.”

14.verse: But he said to him, “Friend, who appointed me a judge or arbitrator between you two?”

15.verse: And he said to them, “Watch out and be on guard against all types of greed, because one’s life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions.”

16.verse: Then he told a parable to them, saying: “The land of a certain rich man produced a good crop.

17.verse: And he thought to himself, saying, ‘What shall I do, for I have no place to store my crops?’

18.verse: Then he said, ‘This is what I will do: I will tear down my barns and I will build bigger ones; and I will store there all my grain and my goods.

19.verse: Then I will say to my soul, “Soul, you have many good things laid up for many years; take your rest, eat, drink, be merry.”’

20.verse: But God said to him, ‘You fool! This very night your soul will be demanded of you. And what you have prepared for yourself, whose will it be?’

21.verse: So it is with the one who stores up treasures for himself, but is not rich toward God.”

22.verse: He said to his disciples, “Therefore I tell you, do not be anxious about your life, what you will eat, nor about your body, what you will wear.

23.verse: For life is more than food, and the body more than clothing.

24.verse: Consider the ravens: for they do not sow, neither do they reap; for them there is neither storehouse nor granary, yet God feeds them. Of how much more value are you than the birds!

25.verse: And which of you by worrying can add a single hour to his span of life?

26.verse: If then, you are unable to accomplish such an insignificant thing, why do you worry about other things?

27.verse: Consider the lilies, how they grow. They neither toil nor spin, yet I tell you, not even Solomon in all his glory clothed himself like one of these.

28.verse: If God so clothes the grass in the field, which is alive today and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, you people of little faith!

29.verse: And you, do not have as an overriding concern what to eat and what to drink; do not let such things bother you.

30.verse: For all the nations of the world have these things as their overriding concern, and your Father knows full well that you need them.

31.verse: Instead, have his kingdom as your overriding concern, and these things will be given to you in addition.

32.verse: Do not be afraid, little flock, because your Father has determined in his pleasure to give you the kingdom.

33.verse: Sell your possessions and give alms. Make for yourselves moneybags that do not wear out, a treasure unfailing in heaven, where no thief comes near and no moth destroys.

34.verse: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be as well.

35.verse: “Let your waists be girded and your lamps burning;

36.verse: and be like men waiting for their master to come home from the wedding, so that when he comes and knocks, they will open the door for him immediately.

37.verse: Fortunate are those servants whom the master finds awake when he comes. Truly I say to you, he will dress himself for service, have them recline at table, and will come and serve them.

38.verse: If he comes in the second or in the third watch and finds it so, those ones are fortunate.

39.verse: “Know this: that if the master of the house had known at what hour the thief would come, he would not have allowed his house be broken into.

40.verse: So you too must be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour when you do not expect him.”

41.verse: Then Peter said, “Lord, are you telling this parable to us or to everyone?”

42.verse: And the Lord said, “Who, then, is the faithful and wise steward, whom the master will put in charge of his servants, to give the food ration at the proper time?

43.verse: Fortunate is that servant whom his master, when he comes, will find doing so.

44.verse: I tell you the truth, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.

45.verse: But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My master is delayed in coming,’ and begins to beat the male and female servants, and to eat and drink and get drunk;

46.verse: then the master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour that he does not know about, and he will cut him in pieces and will assign him his place with the unfaithful.

47.verse: “And that servant who knew his master’s will but did not get ready or act in accord with his will, will be beaten with many blows.

48.verse: But the one who did not know, and did things worthy of blows, will be beaten with few blows. Everyone to whom much was given, much will be required from him, and to whom much was handed over, they will ask more of him.

49.verse: “I came to cast fire on the earth, and would that it were already kindled!

50.verse: I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am until it is completed!

51.verse: Do you think that I came to give peace in the earth? No, I tell you, but rather division!
